title: Micron to invest $9.6 billion in Japan to build AI memory chip plant, Nikkei reports
description: US chipmaker Micron Technology will invest 1.5 trillion yen ($9.6 billion) to build a next-generation memory manufacturing facility in western Japan to support artificial intelligence computing, Nikkei reported on Saturday.
content:
Synopsis
US chipmaker Micron Technology will invest 1.5 trillion yen ($9.6 billion) to build a next-generation memory manufacturing facility in western Japan to support artificial intelligence computing, Nikkei reported on Saturday.

title: Micron to Invest $9.6 Billion in Japan Memory Chip Plant: Nikkei
description: Micron Technology Inc. will spend ¥1.5 trillion ($9.6 billion) to build a plant in western Japan to make memory chips for artificial intelligence applications, Nikkei newspaper reported.
content:
Micron Technology Inc. will spend ¥1.5 trillion ($9.6 billion) to build a plant in western Japan to make memory chips for artificial intelligence applications, Nikkei newspaper reported.
The move comes as Micron looks to diversify advanced chip produ... [252 chars]

title: N.Y. Law Could Set Stage for A.I. Regulation’s Next ‘Big Battleground’
description: The new law seeks to prevent retailers from ripping off consumers by using artificial intelligence and their personal data to charge them higher prices.
content:
As New Yorkers scrolled, surfed and searched their way to digital deals on Black Friday, they had certain unique protections.
This month, New York became the first state to enact a law targeting a practice, typically called personalized pricing or su... [1391 chars]

title: Is Viral Elon Musk-Nikhil Kamath Podcast Teaser AI-Generated? Here’s What Grok Says
description: Kamath released a 39-second black‑and‑white teaser clip on the social media platform X, with the caption “Caption this”, directly tagged with Elon Musk. Users wondered whether the footage was generated by Artificial Intelligence (AI), and they shared their doubt, tagging the Grok model.
content:
Tesla CEO Elon Musk is likely to feature on an upcoming episode of Zerodha founder Nikhil Kamath’s “WTF” podcast, as indicated by Kamath's viral social media post.
Teaser Sparks AI Debate

title: Why do all the new shopping bots recommend the same gift for mom?
description: New artificial intelligence shopping tools are sprouting right and left just in time for the holidays

title: Adani plans up to $5 bn investment in high capacity data centres as Google launches its $15 bn AI hub
description: The move comes as Alphabet-owned Google begins rolling out its massive $15-billion, five-year plan to build an artificial intelligence data hub in Andhra Pradesh, its single largest investment in India
content: India’s Adani Group is gearing up for one of its biggest digital infrastructure bets, planning to invest up to $5 billion in Google’s upcoming India AI data centre project. The move comes as Alphabet-owned Google begins rolling out its massive $15-bi... [1172 chars]

title: How AI May Be Undermining Your Investments
description: Lawyers, consultants, and programmers have both made high-profile mistakes in using artificial intelligence in reports. What corporate decisions are led astray?
content: For the second time this year, Deloitte reportedly used generative artificial intelligence to “find” research citations that would help support their contracted reports to governments. The story is ultimately larger and has a lesson for how people ma... [5394 chars]

title: ‘Clair Obscur’ tops best game list
description: It’s been a difficult year for the people who create video games, with layoffs persisting while the tech industry tries to force us to use artificial intelligence for everything. But great games emerged nonetheless — and I can’t imagine AI ever being able to deliver the kind of thrilling, rewarding adventures we’ve seen in 2025. […]

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Investors on watch for AI updates
description: Investors will look in the coming week for signals about profitability for artificial intelligence companies, as well as the broader economy's health, to steady the US equity market.
content:

title: IUST, KCF sign MoU for joint initiatives in AI, Education & Societal Impact
description: AWANTIPORA, Nov 28: The Islamic University of Science & Technology (IUST) and Kashmir Care Foundation (KCF) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) aimed at advancing Artificial Intelligence (AI), education, climate awareness, and innovation-driven development in Jammu & Kashmir. The signing ceremony was held at the IUST main campus and was presided over by Vice Chancellor IUST, Prof Shakil A Romshoo, and President, Kashmir Care Foundation, Dr Altaf Lal. The event was attended by Prof A H Moon, Dean Academic Affairs; […]
